references.formattedCitation: Sdralia, Anna-Maria, Vasiliki Kassianidou, and Thilo Rehren. “Late Roman Copper Smelting in Polis Chrysochous, Cyprus.” Journal of Archaeological Science: Reports 48 (April 1, 2023): 103889. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jasrep.2023.103889.

description: A copper-smelting slag heap located in the village of Argaka in western Cyprus (Paphos district), dating between the third and eighth centuries CE and likely derived from ore mined at Limni.

properties.title: OSM Location of Argaka village administrative area
